page.title: 16Historic Buildings,Stiffkey.
page.content:
{Church of St.John and St.Mary} Stiffkey:remaining one of two churches on same site dating from 11th. century; buttresses 12th. century, chancel windows 13th. century, perpendicuar nave 15th. century.
{Old Hall Stiffkey:}1573, site of Saxon and other earlier settlements bought from Banyards by Nicholas Bacon,Keeper of the Great Seal(father of Francis Bacon). River diverted and houses moved. Hall comprising 3 wings, 6 towers and gatehouse completed by 1604. Owned by Townshends from 1619 till 20th. century. During periods of decline brick and stone incorporated into other houses in village.
{Cockthorpe Mnaor and Church}date from 15th. century. Church noted for gargoyles.
